alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 2:36AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dale, Henry, southeastern Coffee, northeastern Geneva and Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, Clay, Randolph, northwestern Calhoun, northwestern Early and southern Quitman Counties in southwestern Georgia through 330 AM EST/230 AM CST/... At 236 AM EST/136 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Richards Crossroads to 7 miles southwest of Level Plains. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Abbeville, Cottonwood, Fort Gaines, Blakely, Cuthbert, Headland, Dothan, Ozark, Geneva, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Level Plains, Slocomb and Samson. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
